title: July 29, 2010
content:
Todayâ€™s guest is Karen Ranzi and she is an author and teacher on nutrition, health and child development who has been... <!--more--> working in the natural health movement for over 16 years in the field of nutrition, health, and child development.
She is the Co-Founder of the non-profit organization, Health Liberties Network, which was organized to protect the freedoms of individuals and families in their health care choices, and is a Coordinator in the New Jersey Raw Food Support.
In addition to her work in vegan nutrition, Karen holds a Masters degree in speech pathology from New York University.
Her research has shown that switching to raw plant foods has the ability to heal children of learning disability, attention deficit disorder and autism.
